summary: This is an email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO SDNY) requesting a Spanish interpreter for proffer sessions related to the 'Epstein Death Investigation'. The interpreter, identified only as 'I.', is requested because she has interpreted for the subject in the past. The proffer appointment is scheduled for September 5, 2019.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: The prosecutor handling the case for whom the interpreter is being requested; contact details are listed but the name is not provided in the text.

connections.description: The interpreter 'I.' is being requested by the AUSA for a proffer session, having provided interpretation services for the AUSA's subject in the past.

events.title: Proffer Session for Epstein Death Investigation
events.description: A scheduled proffer session requiring a Spanish interpreter, related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively conducting proffer sessions as part of the 'Epstein Death Investigation' in September 2019.
A Spanish interpreter, referred to as 'I.', was specifically requested for these sessions due to prior experience interpreting for the subject.
The document indicates the investigation into Epstein's death was ongoing and involved witness cooperation through proffers.
